data.text: Concludes this week @UNGeneva: Committee on Enforced Disappearances. Background, documents & more https://t.co/cRBuqaDWPA https://t.co/yzZqQD14Vm

Rights and choices are still out of reach for too many women. @UNPFA is working to address obstacles still standing in the way of women reaching their full potential in life: https://t.co/pOPJoThPi8 https://t.co/KzIubh0zd1

Climate change is a race we can win. 
Join @UNDP's climate champion & #GameOfThrones star @nikolajcw & take urgent #ClimateAction now: https://t.co/zTkumwytsA https://t.co/sjDGIiys07

13.2 million people are in need of health assistance across Syria. @UNHCRinSYRIA supports:
⚕️Medical check-ups & emergency referrals 
⚕️Mental & psycho-social counselling 
⚕️Health awareness sessions
⚕️Health clinics 

https://t.co/Nytqg2oh89 #HealthForAll https://t.co/IqSMHIBrUm

In Sri Lanka, the @UNDP #BuildPeace project offers school gardens for displaced families, where both students and parents can learn about nutrition and farming: https://t.co/KVa4XeWpbK  #GlobalGoals https://t.co/unYMSF7MES

Decent work means dignity, equality, a fair income, and safe working conditions. The #GlobalGoals aim to achieve full & productive employment for all by 2030. https://t.co/6U5kenTnZR https://t.co/LB6oRLeJKs

Health is a human right!  
Everyone should have the information and services they need to take care of their own health and the health of their families. More from @WHO: https://t.co/QVSWiaPGMO https://t.co/DtmSvPwASr
8 years into the war in Syria, @scoop_reardon of @refugees paid a visit to the home where his friend, @Hanialmoulia grew up. This is what he found. ⬇️ https://t.co/OUat267CEA
Change comes from action, and action comes from you. Join Sir David Attenborough in taking daily #ClimateAction to protect our planet: https://t.co/zTkumwytsA https://t.co/pYWAkI7ypk

“Don’t underestimate a person’s courage." Kamani overcame domestic violence & went on to become an award-winning gardener, thanks to support from @WFP. https://t.co/XS5KgTX3FE #ZeroHunger https://t.co/ivMOHNopNO

"As we renew our resolve to prevent such atrocities from ever happening again, we are seeing dangerous trends of rising xenophobia, racism & intolerance." -@antonioguterres marking 25th anniversary of genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda. https://t.co/Yg1bG19iMe #Kwibuka25 https://t.co/8tJRKtrAfo

UN Peacekeepers come from different countries, cultures & backgrounds --
but share a common purpose to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/vGnBByhTMl
Mali: Following last month's attack that left 150+ people dead, see how @unicef is helping the smallest survivors begin to heal: https://t.co/WeCITdstpn #EveryChild

Do you know somebody who is bridging the digital gender gap by helping women and girls get equal access, skills & opportunities in the tech industry?

Tatenda lost her home and all her belongings, including clothes for the baby she is expecting, in #CycloneIdai - but thanks to the "mama kit" from @UNFPA_Zimbabwe, her baby will be warm. https://t.co/eyOws86VrG https://t.co/CjjRcICPuY

Young leaders & influencers made their voices heard on the #SDGLive stage at UNHQ this week. See all the #GlobalGoals panel discussions, interviews and performances here: https://t.co/OxKtFnjP34 https://t.co/tWx7OuxW3k

"On this day of commemoration, let us all pledge to work together to build a harmonious future for all people, everywhere." -- @antonioguterres at event marking 25th anniversary of the genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda. https://t.co/Yg1bG1qUaO #Kwibuka25 https://t.co/BVdxAakTnT

2019 marks 90 years since the first stone was laid at the Palais des Nations, home to @UNGeneva. The trowel used during that official ceremony was recently found in archives. More history here: https://t.co/bJFJdbdROP #FBF https://t.co/gGH0fnoEYB
Friday's International Day of Human Space Flight celebrates the beginning of the space era for mankind: https://t.co/G8QkAkBiXG #FBF https://t.co/l10YnEvXeC

Joining the Rome Statute is a voluntary decision made by sovereign countries. Doing so sends a message: that crimes under the jurisdiction of the @IntlCrimCourt must not go unpunished: https://t.co/m6BwzD115T https://t.co/axO07PAtpK

"We need to do far more to ensure that women’s rights, women’s voices & women’s participation are at the centre of peacekeeping decision-making," @antonioguterres tells Security Council. https://t.co/KAP3Agr0ZY #ServingForPeace https://t.co/vB3VpcGdgd
2 years after Yuri Gagarin became the 1st human to orbit the Earth, he visited the UN. Friday is Human Space Flight Day: https://t.co/JWVtqoToRE #FBF https://t.co/AWvUPfXKGj

#TBT to 1963, when measles killed around 2.6 million people a year. Measles deaths have plummeted by over 95% since then thanks to immunization campaigns. https://t.co/WO1LzJVaCs #VaccinesWork via @WHO https://t.co/mEbMh98Ige

Ireland provides military & police officers to 6 @UNPeacekeeping missions. These brave men & women are #ServingForPeace at great personal risk to protect others. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/BRBJC5qMum

Strong partnerships can help achieve the #GlobalGoals by unlocking financing, mobilizing government policy & more. Find out more at Thursday's @UNECOSOC Partnership Forum: https://t.co/xZpnfvyAaf #Partnerships2030 https://t.co/dYaUfhMRVm

Art for social justice: the #ILO100murals project in New York celebrates the 100th anniversary of @ILO and the efforts of the oldest UN specialized agency to achieve social justice and decent work for all. https://t.co/GxTaV7q6T8 #ILO100 https://t.co/bCzzZCoRN6

Tune in now to see special #ILO100 events happening around the world celebrating @ILO's 100 years of service & looking ahead to the future of work

Watch live here: https://t.co/o10jhT5Qe5 https://t.co/jGJVPP5Zi2

"Girls can do everything. They can play football, tennis, basketball - everything. They are not supposed to be in the kitchen all the time." --  @Lisafreestyle is one of many inspiring young people at this week's @UNECOSOC Youth Forum. https://t.co/VjLFUrjcFZ #Youth2030 https://t.co/SqoWIrcazK

There is still time to:

– stop violence in Libya.
– recognize that there is no military solution.
– move ahead in the political process.

Latest update from @AntonioGuterres is here: https://t.co/34HOM6fkSY https://t.co/QW4SPrQIf7

"I would like to let the young people know not to lose hope. They must believe that everything is possible and that they can transform their lives." 

25 years after the genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda, survivor Emmanuel Muhinda  shares his message of hope for the future. https://t.co/dlCZRFWz5P
Now underway: #ILO100 Global Tour, a round-the-world relay of talks and entertainment celebrating the @ILO Centenary. https://t.co/PMp7F3xKJO

"Once we went to sleep, the clashes started. I was very scared. I already feel relief just by getting on the bus." - pregnant Naima is one of the refugees relocated from a Libyan detention centre to safety by @refugees. https://t.co/zaxleZHRlC #WithRefugees https://t.co/40wZBL9Dd6

7 million Venezuelans – 25% of population – in need of humanitarian assistance, @UNReliefChief tells Security Council.

@AntonioGuterres says UN is working to expand assistance, in line with principles of humanity, neutrality, impartiality & independence. https://t.co/3VKWbnA7RF https://t.co/14BZjbGpAK

"The ILO has been a trusted voice to expand opportunities for young people, open doors and break glass ceilings for women, and ensure social justice in every corner of our world." -- @antonioguterres as @ILO turns 100 https://t.co/2rPq1gq0o0 #ILO100 https://t.co/6RWAS1asJk

Libya: @Refugees extremely alarmed at deteriorating situation in country and has reolocated 150 vulnerable refugees from a south Tripoli detention centre to facility in safe zone. https://t.co/TH21ecsurV #WithRefugees 

 https://t.co/qU5uoq0sER
Human rights don’t differ based on whether you seek safety by land, air or sea. Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/n4ejLcwGPE via @refugees https://t.co/5tgXlw2LcQ

Yemen: As the world's biggest humanitarian crisis moves into it's 4th year, 10 million people are suffering from extreme hunger. Read one family's struggle to survive - and how @UNICEF is helping. https://t.co/upVGYc4777

"While hunger is circumscribed to specific areas, obesity is everywhere. We are witnessing the globalization of obesity". -- @grazianodasilva at @FAO Council stresses need to focus on all forms of malnutrition. https://t.co/Rpj9nGeWIt #globalgoals

With an influx of new refugees & a shortage of resources, @WFP is finding unique ways to support Bangladeshis in the host community just footsteps away from the world's largest refugee camp. https://t.co/MHT4RtcdVt #WithRefugees

Access to quality education, unemployment, inequality, social exclusion & climate change all defining problems of our time, @UNECOSOC President tells annual Youth Forum. https://t.co/jRhjqZC5wU #Youth2030

Yemen: “The people who are the most vulnerable and who need our help and compassion the most are the people paying the highest price." --@OCHAYemen chief following civilian deaths in Sana'a. https://t.co/OITZGAzo5n

@antonioguterres "Whatever happens, the UN will remain committed, and I will remain committed, to support the Libyan people. "It is very demanding and it takes courage for you to forgive."

Survivor Alphonse Kabalisa reflects on the meaning of unity & reconciliation -- and finding the courage to forgive perpetrators of the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda. #Kwibuka25 https://t.co/cbPYi610mO
Bangladesh: climate change threatening lives & futures of over 19 million children. New @unicef report calls for urgent #ClimateAction. Details here: https://t.co/x03Ug7tgx5 https://t.co/eJ9ci74uC8

Trust in international cooperation is in crisis, partly because we are not delivering sustainable development for all. 60+ UN and partner agencies are calling for a global financial system that supports a fair globalization. https://t.co/EjkXWXJA1i #Fin4Dev https://t.co/Y84OG24hkg

"Our country died in 1994 but we are so lucky - because it is slowly coming back to life." 

Fidèle Uwizeye, survivor of the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda, shares his message of hope for his country. #Kwibuka25 https://t.co/FTi9iEekyU

Haiti is “at the crossroads between peacekeeping and development” -- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet tells Security Council, stressing need for strengthened human rights protections in the country. https://t.co/CWOqrspQH6 https://t.co/AR9tr67W8y

On Wednesday, this child was the first to receive a cholera vaccine in Beira, Mozambique following #CycloneIdai. Around 1,500 cases of the disease have already been registered. More on @UNOCHA's lifesaving efforts: https://t.co/Uaigo0jktc https://t.co/zrtjP2a4c4

“A child under the age of 18 dies from violence every day in Honduras. For a country not engaged in active warfare, this figure is staggering" -- @unicefchief on her recent visit to the Central American country https://t.co/oljrmlIFi5  #ENDviolence
